block.p: Jennifer Edith Rosner, the daughter of Eva and Alexander Rosner of Miami Beach, is to be married today to Jason Daniel Eichenholz, the son of Sheryl and Joseph Eichenholz of Englewood, N.J. Rabbi Joshua Berkowitz will officiate at the Doral Country Club in Miami.

The bride, 24, is a research scientist at the New York State Psychiatric Institute at Columbia University in New York. She graduated magna cum laude from Barnard College and received a master's degree in forensic psychology from the John Jay College of Criminal Justice. In the fall, she is to begin studying for a Ph.D. in clinical psychology at Fairleigh Dickinson University. Her father is the president and her mother is the treasurer of the Intertex Trading Corporation, textile machinery dealers in Miami Beach.

Jennifer Edith Rosner, the daughter of Eva and Alexander Rosner of Miami Beach, is to be married today to Jason Daniel Eichenholz, the son of Sheryl and Joseph Eichenholz of Englewood, N.J. Rabbi Joshua Berkowitz will officiate at the Doral Country Club in Miami.

The bride, 24, is a research scientist at the New York State Psychiatric Institute at Columbia University in New York. She graduated magna cum laude from Barnard College and received a master's degree in forensic psychology from the John Jay College of Criminal Justice. In the fall, she is to begin studying for a Ph.D. in clinical psychology at Fairleigh Dickinson University. Her father is the president and her mother is the treasurer of the Intertex Trading Corporation, textile machinery dealers in Miami Beach.

The bridegroom, also 24, is a consultant on e-commerce with the New York office of Siebel Systems, a computer software company. He graduated from Cornell. His mother teaches the first grade at the Cleveland School in Englewood. His father is the senior vice president for electronic publishing at Quadrant HealthCom, a publisher of information for health care professionals, in Chatham, N.J.
